title: firefox tabs crash on kernel 6.0 (and following)
content:
I have Firefox 107.0b5 (64-bits) Snap for Ubuntu canonical-002 - 1.0 I use Ubuntu Mainline to update to newer kernels. Never had any problem doing that. I am now on 5.19.15. But when I upgrade to kernel 6 (which is now at 6.0.5) Firefox tabs crash. Reloading doesn't help. Each new tab I open gives the same crash message. I have to restart to get Firefox going again. So I removed kernel 6 and reverted back to kernel 5.19 and have no problems any more. But question, what is the problem between kernel 6 and firefox? Does anybody else experience this problem? 

I have no other problems with kernel 6 with other programs or hardware or whatever, only firefox tabs crash...

title: Dev question - Floating UI focus bug
content:
Hello. I'm a dev in Ai21Labs. Working on a product called Wordtune. We have a bug in our product that is only reproducible in your browser.

1. open https://app.wordtune.com/v2/editor/ 2. login 3. paste the following text "She is talll" (with 3 L's) 4. wait for the red underline to show 5. click on it (a card will open) 6. try to hover any part of the app - none will respond (cursor & :hover styles). The only responsive one is the editor itself 7. repeat the same steps in chrome/safari - it works 8. focus out the entire browser and then click on the tabs bar - fixes the issue

I added 2 images with the "casual" button hovered, one when it works, and the second when it doesn't.

When I debugged the events, there was no "blur" event when I clicked the text, but still, it acts like I blurred the tab.

I hope I'm asking in the right place, Thank You!

title: Certificati di postazione non più riconosciuti - si blocca
content: Perlomeno da ieri il browser sembra non riconoscere più i Certificati di postazione. Addirittura si blocca ! Se cerco di andare nelle Impostazioni - Privacy e sicurezza - Certificati eppoi clicco Mostra certificati si blocca e non li fa vedere. Provato a ripristinare Firefox, a disinstallarlo e re-installarlo, a vedere se c'erano altri aggiornamenti, ecc. Sono portali di lavoro, per esempio puntofiscosc, o https://portalendr.giustizia.it. title: Results from "awesome" bar open in the same tab, bookmarks and shortcuts do not
content:
https://youtu.be/BQSir2EBjz8

I pinned the new tab page as a way of bringing back the behavior of the new tab page appearing after all other tabs have become closed. Since I don't want to close my other pinned tabs, this is the only way for the new tab page/home page to appear after all unpinned tabs are cleared.

However I notice that search results open in this same tab instead of a new tab, which is a problem that is detrimental for pinned tab users. The point of pinning a tab according to mozilla, is to always keep a website or a page available. If search results are opening in the same tab, the original website that was pinned no longer becomes available.

The solution is to add a preference to allow search results to open in a new tab for pinned tabs. Currently browser.search.openintab is the only relevant option, but that doesn't specifically enable the option of search results to open in a new tab from pinned tabs. In order for the pinned tabs feature to work as mozilla advertises, only results from pinned tabs should open in new tabs so that they don't "take over" the original website that was pinned.

Any help or suggestions would be hugely appreciated.

title: Firefox looks like it is crashing the tab due to videos.
content:
Firefox has not been playing nice, and it is starting to worry me that if I continue to use it, my computer may suffer damage due to crashes.

It only seem to happen when I'm playing videos, such from YouTube and Twitch. It causes most of the time the tab to crash and require me to simply reload the page. There have been 2 times however that it has caused Windows OS to completely crash, requiring a restart. I have a picture of the error codes present, but one thing is shared between them. They all contain the reason EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION_READ. This has pointed me to consider it to be the same issue. It may also be a issue with the new computer itself, or maybe something to do with the graphics card. I'll start with this first to see if it's something bigger or not.

I also hope that the trouble shooting data can also help, as I rather know how to fix this then be secretive with information that may help.

As as a final note, as of this moment, while being within safe mode/trouble shooting mode, no tabs have crashed yet. Hope this is a sign, but I'll keep it on just to make sure the videos aren't crashing anymore.
creator: rwgamming
